result.execSummary:
The defendant Drexel G. Lay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Drexel G. Lay is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Drexel G. Lay was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Drexel G. Lay was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Complete Circle of Change Program.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed.  Deft pleads no contest to cts 2 & 3.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 2 & 3.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 15 months w/conditions, concurrent on cts 2 & 3.

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Violent Contact w/ Jessica L.
940.235(1) Strangulation and Suffocation, DV   /   940.19(1) Battery, DV   /   947.01(1) DC, DV

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Atty Ward requests to modify bond conditions; requests to adjourn trial as the State needs to discuss resoltuion of case w/DA.  Court amends bond to amend conditions to *Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Violent Contact w/ Jessica L.  Court adjourns JS from 2/9/15 at 9am; sets STC for 3/5/15 at 8:45am.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA C McNeill

Judge Chad Kerkman, Acting Br. 6 for today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John A. Ward.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 2/5/15 at 1:15.  Jury selection  2/9/15 at 9:00.  Jury trial 2/10/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 10/6/14 at 10am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Ward.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Ward acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 8/15/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 8/27/14 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Joseph Kennedy for Atty. John Ward. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 6-3-14 @ 8:15am. Information filed. Bond continued.

133 p.m.  Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Ward. Clk  LE   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 5/21/14 @ 915 a.m.  $2500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Jessica L or her residence except for contact necessary for attending funeral.
